Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கூற்றத்தைக் கையால் விளித்தற்றால் ஆற்றுவார்க்கு ஆற்றாதார் இன்னா செயல்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The weak doing evil to the strong is like beckoning Yama to come (and destroy them).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A small, weak person ('ஆற்றாதார்') is shown committing a harmful act ('இன்னா செயல்') against a vastly more powerful person ('ஆற்றுவார்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: This foolish act is shown to be equivalent to another act: the weak person is simultaneously shown using their hand to cheerfully wave and beckon ('கையால் விளித்து') to the terrifying, skeletal figure of Death (Yama - 'கூற்றம்'), who is standing nearby.
Layered_Composition.Background: Yama, having been summoned by the foolish act, is now turning his attention to the weak person and beginning to approach them, ready to claim their life.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: When a weak person harms a strong one, it is the same as beckoning Death to come and take them.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The direct, parallel action of harming the strong and beckoning Death is the central concept. This illustrates that the act is suicidal.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Suicidal folly, reckless, summoning one's own doom.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A dark, ominous atmosphere. The figure of Death is cloaked in shadow, but their eyes can glow with a menacing light. The foolish person is unaware of the immediate consequence of their beckoning.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that includes the weak person, the strong person they are offending, and the figure of Death they are summoning, all in one narrative frame.

Cultural_Anchors: The weak harming the strong ('ஆற்றாதார் இன்னா செயல்')
Like beckoning Death with the hand ('கூற்றத்தைக் கையால் விளித்தற்றால்')
The suicidal nature of foolish aggression.
